website_summaries.verdict: More expensive than some similar options, but its build quality ensures it will look great for a long time to come.
pros: One of the sharpest looking hex bars you'll find with a high-quality polished chrome finish
The knurled grip on the handles means your hands shouldn't slip
Gives you a really nice build quality, making use of high-level materials
cons: Weight capacity is limited to 400 pounds, which is disappointing, considering the price you're paying

customer_reviews.title: A good bar but more attention required in quality control
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bar but it had two places where there was sharp slag that should have been ground off before chrome plating. It also developed rust on one end that had to removed with metal polish and must be polished every week since I got it. I didn't know if this bar was actually worth the expense when it was ordered, but it is great for shrugs and I like it for squats due to a shoulder injury that won't allow me to shoulder a standard bar. I also use it for light deadlifts; I don't go heavy anymore so I can't evaluate it for anything over 315lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: The bar for above weekend warriors
customer_reviews.text: OK, just going to be a little knit-picky here. On the left side of the sleeve nearest the bar, for the first two inches is smaller round than the rest of the sleeve. My BodyOps collars are slightly sloppy on that side just for that amount. It just makes me wonder about the balance when I start working my way up in weight. However, the bar itself is fantastic. The welds are clean and strong. The handles are perfect. And it came arrived very quickly and wrapped in great shape. Overall I'd give this a 4.75 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Alpha

customer_reviews.title: This bar is a beast.

For the first time in decades, I can do negative reps while doing a squat movement when working my legs. Good for shrugs too, of course.

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed the bar today but I have not used it. It was 41 lbs. on my scale, which is lighter than I expected. It is evenly balanced side to side and front to back. The knurling is sufficient to give a good grip, but not so deep that it's painful. There is enough room for at least 4 x 45 lbs. Ivanko polyurethane plates & collar per side, but I have not actually loaded the bar to see if a 5th will fit. The chrome finish is not even everywhere, and some of the welds are a little messy but appear to be strong. It appears to be an excellent bar for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H

customer_reviews.title: Love this trap bar
customer_reviews.text: Love this trap bar. Great bar for the price. Very versatile can be used for deadlift shrugs calf raises and even flip it for shoulder presses. Bar is more compact than expected but for me it's a good thing if limited space is factor. Sleeves are also on the shorter side so if you progress to over 500lbs this bar will not accommodate you. You will definitely pull more weight with this bar versus standard barbell deadlift due to leverage. Also this bar is not rackable so if racking it for heavy pulls shrugs or presses then look for one that's rackable. Overall I'm happy with this purchase and would recommend it.

customer_reviews.title: Good bar for the money

I've used it several times now, and it works as you'd expect it to. When you place the bar down on the ground on top of the raised handles, it doesn't sit completely flat, so there's a very slight bit of warpage there, but not a big deal. Otherwise, it seems pretty solid, though I haven't put more than 300 pounds on this thing yet. Still, if I were to buy another bar of this type, I wouldn't hesitate to buy this one again.
